title: Ethiopia: Ethiopia's Rural Electrification to Increase in the Coming Fiscal Year
text:
Ethiopia's Rural Electrification to Increase in the Coming Fiscal Year Tagged: Ethiopia: Rio 2016 - the Greatest Sport Festivity in the Heart of Brazil 
As part of the Climate Resilient Green Economy plans, Ethiopia is to work on a new rural electrification program, the Ministry of Water Irrigation and Energy (MoWIE) announced to the press over the weekend. The Rural Electrification Fund Office (RE) stated that it plans to purchase and distribute 4,404 solar home systems (SHS) and 24 institutional solar systems in 2015/16. It also stated a new five-year project for the purchase and distribution of 200,000 SHS and 600,000 improved cook stoves. 
The MoWIE's Alternative Energy Technology Development and Transformation Directorate, which manages the programs, announced the program works with different donor organizations to deliver the SHS and institutional solar systems to parts of the country that are not connected to the national grid. Yisehak Seboka, RE head at the MoWIE, mentioned the directorate is also forming a new team for the new SHS and stove project. However, the MoFED had approved only half of the 52 million Birr budget that had been requested for the RE, which uses government budget for salaries, per diems and training. Responding during the Budget hearing, Abraham Tekeste (PhD), State Minister for Finance and Economic Development, said that the RE had more financial resources from donors including the United Nations Development Program (UNDP), Power Africa, Energy Plus, the World Bank, and the United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF). Yishak Seboka, on his part, noted that these donors contribute 80pc to 85pc of the total budget; the balance coming from the government. Ethiopia
